suppress.notes: Suppressing false positive - the testContainers mysql plugin is a different thing to the actual mysql database.
Suppressing false positive - the flyway mysql plugin is a different thing to the actual mysql database.
Suppressing false positive - the testContainers mariadb plugin is a different thing to the actual mariadb database.
Suppressing false positive - the mariadb r2dbc client is a different thing to the actual mariadb database.
Suppressing false positives - the kotlin annotation processing lib is not the same as "Processing Foundation"
Suppressing false positive - seems to relate to hibernate validator, not the mysql connector itself.
Suppressing false positive - mockito-junit-jupiter is a different thing to JUnit itself
Suppressing false positive - r2dbc-postgresql is versioned separately from postgresql itself
Suppressing false positive - relate only to C++/OJDBC connectors, not java per https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html

Recce is not subject to these H2 DB CVEs because we do not expose the H2 console or deploy H2 in the main application. Additionally, CVE-2018-14335 is disputed (and maybe only relevant for H2 1.4.197) and does not appear to be a real vulnerability.
suppress.vulnerabilityName: CWE-94: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
